definition: to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.chinese: 进展慢腾腾得叫人泄气。

sentences.english: She trekked down to the library.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢腾腾地走到图书馆。

sentences.english: He wiped his hands on his fatigue trousers with a slow thorough motion .
sentences.chinese: 他慢腾腾一丝不苟地把手在破裤子上擦了几擦。

sentences.english: At last they heard feet coming slowly towards the door.
sentences.chinese: 最后他们终于听到了脚步慢腾腾地向门口走来。

sentences.english: I'm to be late for my date.
sentences.chinese: 我约会要晚了，你总是那么慢慢腾腾的。

sentences.english: Then, belatedly, an umbrella of governance would be added.
sentences.chinese: 然后，才慢腾腾的添加治理这把保护伞。

sentences.english: In the centre of the yard, a few loose chickens were sluggishly wandering around.
sentences.chinese: 在院子里，还有几只散放的鸡在慢腾腾地走着。

sentences.english: She turned, and went deliberately out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 她扭过身去，慢腾腾地从房里走出去。

sentences.english: "We shall, dearest, of course; next year. " Her voice lingered over it.
sentences.chinese: “我们当然会的，亲爱的，到明年，”她慢腾腾地说。

sentences.english: I heard footsteps slowly coming down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听见有脚步声慢腾腾地走下楼来。

sentences.english: Then slowly tell side juniors, I go, there is no.
sentences.chinese: 然后慢腾腾地告诉身旁的晚辈，我走了，就没有了。

sentences.english: Cloud is wearing a smile to very slowly sit down to go, deep breathing.
sentences.chinese: 云含笑慢慢腾腾的坐下去，深呼吸。
韩佳，我这怎么叫慢腾腾。

sentences.english: I'm to be late for my date. You're so, you're always so sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 我约会要晚了，你总是那么慢慢腾腾的。

sentences.english: The old man drank his coffee slowly.
sentences.chinese: 老人慢腾腾地喝着咖啡。

definition: with one's hands clasped behind one's back
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
